title: Moncton airport evacuated as RCMP conduct investigation | CBC News
text:
Greater Moncton Roméo LeBlanc International Airport was evacuated Sunday evening as RCMP investigated an unspecified incident.

Airport spokesperson Julie Pondant told CBC News in an email that evacuations began shortly before 7:00 pm AT and that two flights have been redirected to other airports. She added that departures and arrivals have been suspended.

Pondant said RCMP officers arrived shortly after to investigate, but said she didn't know the nature of the investigation.

RCMP told CBC News around 8:30 p.m. AT that it completed its search and found nothing. RCMP did not elaborate on the nature of the search.
